newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan, S.Korea agree to raise air traffic capacity.
newsitem.headline: Japan, S.Korea agree to raise air traffic capacity.

text.p: Japan and South Korea have agreed to increase air passenger traffic capacity between the two countries, Japan's Ministry of Transport said on Thursday in a statement.

Japan and South Korea agreed that both nations can increase capacity by two B767 flights a week between Osaka and Pusan and three B767 flights a week between Okayama and Seoul, and between Hiroshima and Seoul.
Most measures will take effect from April, although some flights between Osaka and Pusan will only take effect from October.
They also agreed that Japan Asia Airways, Japan TransOcean Air and Air Nippon will be allowed to enter the market, the statement said.
Three South Korean cities, Taegu, Kwangu and Chonju and two Japanese cities, Osaka and Fukuoka were added as new points of entry and departure.
A framework for codesharing was also agreed on.
